statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem graphically}\\ \text{Minimise} Z=-3x+4y \\ \text{subject to the constraints} \\ x+2y \le 8,\, 3x + 2y \le 12,\, x \ge 0,\, y \ge 0

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
step.reason: \text{Given the constraints}\\ x+2y \le 8,\, 3x + 2y \le 12,\, x \ge 0,\, y \ge 0 \\ \text{the area would be restricted to}\\ X\text{ and } Y\text{ axes, and } x+2y=8 \\ \text{in }x=[0, 2] \text{ and } 3x+2y=12\text{ in }x=[2,4]

step.context: \text{What is the value of the Minumum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.reason: \text{Minumum is calculated by substituting}\\ \text{the correct corner points into the }\\ \text{objective function } Z=-3x+4y \\ \text{Corner points are the bounding box}\\ \text{of the overlapping region}
